text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>
  <NUM>20.</NUM>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Falckeisische Bibel</TITLE>
    <NOTE>noch gantz neu in</NOTE>
    <FORMAT>Schweins-leder</FORMAT>
    <BINDING>gebunden</BINDING>
    <NOTE>†</NOTE>
    <PRICE>12. Gulden</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <ALTERNATIVE>
    oder gegen einem neuen
    <BIBL>
      <TITLE>Corpore Juris</TITLE>
      <PLACE>Leipziger Edition</PLACE>
    </BIBL>
    zu vertauschen.
  </ALTERNATIVE>
</ITEM>","number_of_corrections":8,"explanation":"1) Wrapped the leading number in <NUM>20.</NUM> to separate it from the item text and make the structure clearer.
2) Split the descriptive phrase around the first <BIBL> into <NOTE> ("noch gantz neu in") and <BINDING> ("gebunden") to avoid having untagged text squeezed inside bibliographic structure.
3) Corrected tag name <PRIZE> to the more standard <PRICE> while keeping the content "12. Gulden".
4) Converted the garbled character sequence "\u221a\u2020" to a single, meaningful symbol † and wrapped it in <NOTE> to preserve it as an annotation.
5) Moved the trailing comma after </BIBL> outside of the <BIBL> element so that the bibliographic block contains only the book-related information.
6) Wrapped the alternative-exchange clause ("oder gegen einem neuen ... zu vertauschen") in an <ALTERNATIVE> element to distinguish it from the primary offer.
7) Ensured the second book reference ("Corpore Juris", "Leipziger Edition") is fully enclosed in its own <BIBL> element under <ALTERNATIVE> for consistent bibliographic structure.
8) Normalized indentation and line breaks to produce well-formed, readable XML and to ensure that all tags are properly opened and closed."}

parsed.fixed_xml:
<ITEM>
  <NUM>20.</NUM>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Falckeisische Bibel</TITLE>
    <NOTE>noch gantz neu in</NOTE>
    <FORMAT>Schweins-leder</FORMAT>
    <BINDING>gebunden</BINDING>
    <NOTE>†</NOTE>
    <PRICE>12. Gulden</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <ALTERNATIVE>
    oder gegen einem neuen
    <BIBL>
      <TITLE>Corpore Juris</TITLE>
      <PLACE>Leipziger Edition</PLACE>
    </BIBL>
    zu vertauschen.
  </ALTERNATIVE>
</ITEM>
parsed.explanation:
1) Wrapped the leading number in <NUM>20.</NUM> to separate it from the item text and make the structure clearer.
2) Split the descriptive phrase around the first <BIBL> into <NOTE> ("noch gantz neu in") and <BINDING> ("gebunden") to avoid having untagged text squeezed inside bibliographic structure.
3) Corrected tag name <PRIZE> to the more standard <PRICE> while keeping the content "12. Gulden".
4) Converted the garbled character sequence "\u221a\u2020" to a single, meaningful symbol † and wrapped it in <NOTE> to preserve it as an annotation.
5) Moved the trailing comma after </BIBL> outside of the <BIBL> element so that the bibliographic block contains only the book-related information.
6) Wrapped the alternative-exchange clause ("oder gegen einem neuen ... zu vertauschen") in an <ALTERNATIVE> element to distinguish it from the primary offer.
7) Ensured the second book reference ("Corpore Juris", "Leipziger Edition") is fully enclosed in its own <BIBL> element under <ALTERNATIVE> for consistent bibliographic structure.
8) Normalized indentation and line breaks to produce well-formed, readable XML and to ensure that all tags are properly opened and closed.
